result.execSummary:
The defendant James E Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Comply with all rules and requirements of the Drug Court Program.  Successsfully complete Drug Court prior to termination of probation

Cooperate and testify truthfully as required by the State

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 152 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
Initial 20 days are to be served in custody without release.  Remainder of sentence is STAYED - to be used at the discretion of the PO and Drug Court

No sentence credit on jail sentence
.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 14CF462
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Comply with any programming deemed appropriate by the PO

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Pay Court Financial obligations as originally ordered

SEH cont'd to 8-11-16 @ 2:30 w/ RAG
Revocation Summary
Tom Locante

State by Skemp & DRG CRT Team /  Def in custody w/ Atty Eric Sanford
EXPULSION HRG
Team has made recommendation for expulsion
Skemp address issues that went into expulsion recommendation
Sanford comments...result did not go our way...explains def's history & struggles.  Evaluation was done but def hasn't had chance to deal w/ results...addresses reasons def did not want to stay @ SA - def didn't feel safe enviornment due to past associations w/ people he knows there
Def comments...wants another chance to prove himself- to prove he can be honest.  Did make a lot of mistakes - def has letter from SA store about def's good volunteer work
CRT:  biggest concern is def's cont'd use throughout - short periods of sobriety but use was continuous.  DRG CRT provides tools for sobriety, what's non-negotiable is attitude of wanting to be sober & wanting to use tools provided - Team feels def may be lacking in that.  CRT never understood the def's reaction to the housing issue - def had knowledge of issues but maintained attitude of defiance - lack of authority - CRT is not seeing the effort...
Def comments...was scared
CRT:  I would like to go along w/ your request to be retained but team made a recommendation to expel.  There are many people who have a need for DRG CRT, we don't do well w/ people who aren't putting forth the effort.  If it were just the relapse issue, the Team's recommendation may have been different but the attitude of defiance does not bode well.  
CRT:  MOTION TO EXPEL IS GRANTED.  Def is remanded to custody of the Sheriff

Def P
CRT: def taken into custody immediately - Motion to expel made by team
Filed in 14CF462
